title: Dimitris Fotakis
text:
Dimitris Fotakis () is Associate Professor of Theoretical <a href="Computer%20Science">Computer Science</a> at the <a href="National%20Technical%20University%20of%20Athens">National Technical University of Athens</a>. He is a prominent researcher in the field of <a href="algorithmic%20game%20theory">algorithmic game theory</a>.
Born and raised in <a href="Patras">Patras</a>, he received a Computer Engineering Diploma (1994) and a PhD in Computer Science (1999) from the Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, <a href="University%20of%20Patras">University of Patras</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a>. From September 2001 till September 2003, he was a Postdoctoral Researcher at the <a href="Max-Planck-Institut">Max-Planck-Institut</a> für Informatik, Algorithms and Complexity Group, Saarbrücken, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. Since February 2009, he has been a faculty member with the Division of Computer Science, School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, <a href="National%20Technical%20University%20of%20Athens">National Technical University of Athens</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a>.
